1.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Noach, the patriarch of the flood
Shem, a son of Noah (often includ. his posterity)
Cham, a son of Noah; also (as a patronymic) his descendants or their country
Jepheth, a son of Noah; also his posterity
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)

2.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jepheth, a son of Noah; also his posterity
Gomer, the name of a son of Japheth and of his descendants; also of a Hebrewess
Magog, a son of Japheth; also a barbarous northern region
Madai, a country of central Asia
Javan, the name of a son of Joktan, and of the race (Ionians, i.e. Greeks) descended from him, with their territory; also of a place in Arabia
Tubal, a postdiluvian patriarch and his posterity
Meshek, a son of Japheth, and the people descended from him

3.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Gomer, the name of a son of Japheth and of his descendants; also of a Hebrewess
Ashkenaz, a Japhethite, also his descendants
Riphath, a grandson of Japheth and his descendants
Togarmah, a son of Gomer and his posterity

4.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Javan, the name of a son of Joktan, and of the race (Ionians, i.e. Greeks) descended from him, with their territory; also of a place in Arabia
Tarshish, a place on the Mediterranean, hence, the ephithet of a merchant vessel (as if for or from that port); also the name of a Persian and of an Israelite
a Kittite or Cypriote; hence, an islander in general, i.e. the Greeks or Romans on the shores opposite Palestine
Dodanites, or descendants of a son of Javan

5.brief: to break through, i.e. spread or separate (oneself)
properly, a habitable spot (as desirable); dry land, a coast, an island
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
a family, i.e. circle of relatives; figuratively, a class (of persons), a species (of animals) or sort (of things); by extension a tribe or people
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts

Kenaan, a son a Ham; also the country inhabited by him
